org.apache.polygene.valueserialization.orgjson

Class OrgJsonValueDeserializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.polygene.spi.value.ValueDeserializerAdapter<JSONTokener,Object>
      • org.apache.polygene.valueserialization.orgjson.OrgJsonValueDeserializer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ValueDeserializer

    public class OrgJsonValueDeserializer
extends ValueDeserializerAdapter<JSONTokener,Object>
    ValueDeserializer reading Values from JSON documents using org.json.

      • readMapInMap

        protected <K,V> Map<K,V> readMapInMap(ModuleDescriptor module,
                                      JSONTokener input,
                                      Function<JSONTokener,K> keyDeserializer,
                                      Function<JSONTokener,V> valueDeserializer,
                                      Map<K,V> map)
                               throws Exception
        Description copied from class: ValueDeserializerAdapter
        A Map<K,V> is serialized in an array of entries objects.

        Here is an example in JSON:

         [
     { "key": "foo",       "value": "bar"   },
     { "key": "cathedral", "value": "bazar" }
 ]

        And an empty Map:

        []

        This allow to use any type as keys and values while keeping the Map order at the cost of having non-predictible order of key/value inside an entry object.

        Specified by:
        readMapInMap in class ValueDeserializerAdapter<JSONTokener,Object>
        Type Parameters:
        K - Parameterized map key type
        V - Parameterized map value type
        Parameters:
        module - Module descriptor
        input - Input
        keyDeserializer - Map key deserialization function
        valueDeserializer - Map value deserialization function
        map - Map
        Returns:
        The filled map or null if no array
        Throws:
        Exception - that will be wrapped in a ValueSerializationException
